class_features.name: Level 1 Feature
class_features.desc: During your class training you learned several specialized abilities (called 'features', to separate them from Ability Scores).

class_features.name: Level 1 Feature 2
class_features.desc: Beginning at 1st level, you have a number of features from your class training.

class_features.name: Level 1 Feature 3
class_features.desc: At 1st level, you gain several features based on your class. You get even more at higher levels.

class_features.name: Level 1 Feature 4
class_features.desc: Sometimes, you choose your subclass at level 1, and this subclass then gives you one or more features immediately, as well as several more at various higher levels.

class_features.name: Level 2 Feature
class_features.desc: Starting at 2nd level, you gain additional abilities from your class. Some classes may gain more than one feature, while others may only gain new spells and spell slots.

class_features.name: Level 3 Feature: Archetype Choice
class_features.desc: At 3rd level (for the majority of classes, anyway), you choose an archetype that you emulate in the exercise of your class abilities. Your archetype choice grants you features at 3rd level and then again at 6th, 10th, and 14th level.

class_features.name: Ability Score Improvement
class_features.desc: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

class_features.name: Level 5 Feature
class_features.desc: Starting at 5th level, you gain another class feature. Some classes may only gain new spells and spell slots, while others may gain more than one feature.

class_features.name: Level 7 Feature
class_features.desc: Sometimes a class feature will be repeated at a later level, either as an improvement on an earlier ability (such as an increased bonus) or an expansion of its capabilities (such as the Rogue's Expertise or the Fighter's Extra Attack).

class_features.name: Level 8 Feature: ASI
class_features.desc: Most classes don't get a new feature at level 8, but they do get an ASI. And new spells, for (some of) the spellcasting classes.

class_features.name: Level 9 Feature
class_features.desc: Beginning at 9th level, you get ... another class feature! Sometimes it's just more spells and new spell slots, though.

class_features.name: Level 11 Feature
class_features.desc: By 11th level, you've learned even more cool things from your class. Or at least, learned new spells and figured out how to optimize your spellcasting so you can cast more spells per day.

class_features.name: Level 12 Feature: ASI
class_features.desc: As at level 8, most classes just get an ASI as their Level 12 Class Feature. And spell-stuff, for the spellcasting classes.

class_features.name: Level 13 Feature
class_features.desc: At level 13, I'm starting to run out of different ways to say 'you get *another* class feature! Except it could just be more spell-stuff.' At least I'm more than halfway done...

class_features.name: Level 15 Feature
class_features.desc: Starting at 15th level, you get ... ANOTHER FEATURE, and (if you're a spellcaster) MORE SPELLS!

class_features.name: Level 16 Feature: ASI
class_features.desc: Um, I'm still running out of descriptions...

class_features.name: Level 17 Feature
class_features.desc: By 17th level, you have acquired yet another class feature, and perhaps more spell-stuff (if you're a spellcaster).

class_features.name: Level 18 Feature
class_features.desc: Beginning at 18th level, you gain another Class Feature. How many of these do you get, anyway?

class_features.name: Level 19 Feature: ASI
class_features.desc: Finally, the last ASI you gain. Only one more level to go...unless your GM is ok with one or more of the available 'Epic Level' rules available, or has decided to make up their own.

class_features.name: Capstone Feature
class_features.desc: At 20th level, you have reached the end of normal character progression. Congratulations, here's a cool feature related to your chosen class's stereotypical theme! Acutally, some of these 'capstone features' are pretty cool, at least by description. Too bad it's hard to find a campaign where a character who started at level 1 actually gets to use their capstone ability. Most games that reach this level either start at a higher level or end up killing off the characters who started at level one before they get this far. Or the character decided to multiclass, and never gets any of their classes' capstone features.
